list_definition.definition: hard to do or understand; not easy

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: It is difficult to know what to do for the best.

list_definition.definition: hard to deal with or needing to be treated etc in a special way

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a difficult child who often misbehaves.

list_ex_of_english: Furthermore, for immunological analysis it is difficult to exclude the possibility that the parasites carry antibody derived from the host.
Without such information it is difficult to determine accurately which category a particular word falls into.
Designing robots that can respond has proved extremely difficult and progress has been slow.
If the spread between foldons is not greater than the spread within, their discrimination will be difficult.
The true extend of cross subsidies is often difficult to measure.
The necessity of identity is more difficult to reject.
Evidence for learningbased change is usually more difficult to collect.
He is difficult to dismiss as just an irrationalist.
